intro: Pleurothallis curtii, commonly known as the small-leafed orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-white or yellowish flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Pleurothallis curtii is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
